dt-option.name: buttons.buttons.action
dt-option.summary: Action to take when the button is activated

default.value: Default action depends upon the button type. Please refer to the button type documentation

type.scope: DataTables API instance for the selected button - i.e. `b-api button()` for the button in question
type.parameter: Event object that triggered the event
A DataTables API instance for the host DataTable
jQuery instance for the button node that was clicked on
type.returns: No return value is required or expected. No action is taken upon any value that is returned.
type.description: The function is executed when the button is activated, allowing some action to be triggered by the end user.

dt-option.description:
This function defined the action that the button will take when activated by the end user. This will normally be to perform some operation on the DataTable, but can be absolutely anything since the function can be defined by yourself.
Buttons can be activated a number of different ways:
* Mouse: Click * Mobile: Tap on the button * Keyboard: _tab_ to navigate the buttons and _return_ to activate * API: `b-api button().trigger()`
